conclusion: The graph shows a straight line passing through the points (t = -2 s, x/t = 0 m/s) and (t = 0 s, x/t = 10 m/s).

premise: The graph shows a straight line passing through the points (t = -2 s, x/t = 0 m/s) and (t = 0 s, x/t = 10 m/s).
conclusion: The gradient of the line is (10 - 0)/(0 - (-2)) = 5 (m/s)/s.

premise: The gradient of the line is 5 (m/s)/s.
conclusion: For t ≥ 0 s, the line obeys x/t = 10 + 5t.

premise: For t ≥ 0 s, the line obeys x/t = 10 + 5t.
conclusion: Multiply by t to obtain the position as a function of time: x = t(10 + 5t) = 10t + 5t².
Differentiate to get the instantaneous speed (velocity magnitude): v = dx/dt = 10 + 10t.
At the end of the 2nd second (t = 2 s): v = 10 + 10(2) = 30 m/s.
